etymology.description: Depicts a broom with bristles on top and a tied handle at the bottom -> stylized as 肀(肀) (yù, "brush") + 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") + 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth")
etymology.interpretation: The character 帚(帚) (zhǒu, "broomstick") originally depicted a simple broom with its bristles spread out, emphasizing its use as a cleaning tool. Its form evolved, incorporating shapes resembling a brush and cloth, which metaphorically align with cleaning and sweeping.

examples.chinese: 他拿起帚(帚)，开始打扫房间(開始打掃房間)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ zhǒu, kāishǐ dǎsǎo fángjiān.
examples.english: He picked up the broomstick, and began cleaning the room.

examples.chinese: 扫帚在风中飞舞(掃帚在風中飛舞)。
examples.english: The broomstick danced in the wind.
